title.value: Sparse Bayesian Networks: Efficient Uncertainty Quantification in Medical Image Analysis
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Sparse Bayesian Networks: Efficient Uncertainty Quantification in Medical Image Analysis

extractions.description: The paper introduces a training procedure for a sparse (partial) Bayesian network, aimed at improving efficiency in predictive uncertainty quantification in medical images. The novel method selectively assigns Bayesian parameters, significantly reducing computational costs while maintaining high performance in classification and segmentation tasks in medical imaging.

type.justification: The paper includes experimental results and comparative performance metrics on medical datasets, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: Experimental results in classification and segmentation demonstrate that assigning only 1% of the network parameters as Bayesian can yield high-quality predictive uncertainty while preserving model performance.

name.justification: The research is focused on medical image analysis, a subfield of Computer Vision.
name.quote: This study introduces a training procedure for a sparse (partial) Bayesian network. Our method selectively assigns a subset of parameters as Bayesian by assessing their deterministic saliency through gradient sensitivity analysis. The resulting network combines deterministic and Bayesian parameters, exploiting the advantages of both representations to achieve high task-specific performance and minimize predictive uncertainty. Demonstrated on multi-label ChestMNIST for classification and ISIC, LIDC-IDRI for segmentation, our approach achieves competitive performance and predictive uncertainty estimation by reducing Bayesian parameters by over 95%, significantly reducing computational expenses compared to fully Bayesian and ensemble methods.

name.justification: The paper specifically focuses on the analysis of medical images for classification and segmentation.
name.quote: Efficiently quantifying predictive uncertainty in medical ima- ges remains a challenge. Demonstrated on multi-label ChestMNIST for classification and ISIC, LIDC-IDRI for segmentation, our approach achieves competitive performance and predictive uncertainty estimation.

is_compared.quote: Our experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed training paradigm with sparse Bayesian parameter representation, achieving competitive performance against benchmark Bayesian and Ensemble methods (Table 1, Figure 4).
